intro: Octomeria connellii, commonly known as the Connell's octomeris, is a rare flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. It typically grows in rocky soils and is found in specific habitats such as cliffs and canyons. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
